alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:32PM CDT until April 19 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water is flowing over portions of Hood Road and extensive agricultural flooding is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 13.9 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 15.9 feet Monday morning. It will fall below flood stage again late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
